results:
The search results confirm the box office figures you mentioned for The Hobbit trilogy. Here are the key findings:

The Hobbit trilogy as an overall box office smash, as all three films grossed more than $950 million, and altogether, they pulled in $2.93 billion.(no content)Only one of them managed to join the billion-dollar club. The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey was released in 2012 as the first film in the Lord of the Rings franchise since The Return of the King in 2003.(no content)An Unexpected Journey made $1.01 billion, followed by $959 million for The Desolation of Smaug and $956 million for The Battle of the Five Armies.(no content)The promise of Benedict Cumberbatch's Smaug drove a lot of audience interest in the film, which ultimately grossed $959 million worldwide.(no content)Coming in just $3 million above The Desolation of Smaug is the final chapter of the Hobbit trilogy, The Battle of the Five Armies.(no content)Warner Bros.' faith in director Peter Jackson to make The Hobbit films has paid off in nearly $2 billion in global box office receipts for the first two films, but the cost of the trilogy has bumped up to $745 million, according to financial documents filed in New Zealand this month, AP reports. The first film, The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey grossed $1.011 billion worldwide, while The Hobbit: the Desolation of Smaug fell just shy of the billion dollar mark, taking $958 million globally.

The search results confirm that:
- The Hobbit trilogy grossed a combined $2.93 billion worldwide
- An Unexpected Journey made approximately $1 billion (sources vary between $1.01-1.011 billion)
- The Desolation of Smaug made $959 million
- The Battle of the Five Armies made $956-962 million (sources show slight variations)

These figures align closely with the box office numbers mentioned in your search query.
